dct_title_s: Orbis terrarum typus de integro multis in locis emendatus
dct_alternative_sm: Orbis terrarvm typvs de integro multis in locis emendatus
dct_description_sm: auctore Petro Plancio, 1594 ; Ioannes Ã  Duetecum iunior fecit.

Double hemispherical map of the world, with 2 smaller celestial hemispheres. New Guinea shown as part of southern continent called Magallanica. The two hemispheres are surrounded by representations of Europa, Asia, Mexicana, Peruana, Africa, and Magallanica.
dct_rights_sm: Images from the The Renaissance Exploration Collection courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
